marketNews.title: Prospective Ministers Summoned, Sri Mulyani Again Asked to Serve as Finance Minister
marketNews.content: President-elect Prabowo Subianto, on Monday (14/10) night called a number of prospective ministers and deputy ministers for the upcoming cabinet. The following are key notes: Number of ministries increases – Prabowo called 49 people last night and confirmed that there will be additional calls for remaining minister and deputy minister candidates on Tuesday (15/10). Although it is not yet known which will become ministers or deputy ministers and their ministries, the number of calls appears consistent with reports that the number of ministries will increase in the upcoming administration. Earlier, the upcoming administration was reported to have 46 ministries, up from the current 34 ministries. Economy‑related ministers – 10 of the 17 ministers we consider directly related to the economy in the current administration were called last night. This aligns with previous reporting that Prabowo will retain many ministers from the current cabinet. Responding to the call, Sri Mulyani disclosed that she has again been asked to become Finance Minister. Sri Mulyani also signaled that she is open to continuing in that role. Planned separation of the State Revenue Agency (BPN) – At the same time, Sri Mulyani dismissed the idea of establishing a BPN. Previously, Prabowo was reported to plan to separate the Directorate General of Taxes (DJP) and the Directorate General of Customs and Excise (DJBC) from the Ministry of Finance in an effort to increase state revenue. Key Takeaway: Although further clarification is needed, we assess the political developments as generally positive for the market. If the economy‑related ministers retain their positions in the upcoming administration, this will provide certainty and relief for the market that economic stability can be maintained. However, risk arises from the significant increase in the number of ministries which could cause inefficiency. On Tuesday (15/10) the IDX Composite (IHSG) rose 0.89% to 7,627 with net foreign inflow of 289.5 billion rupiah. Meanwhile the rupiah weakened slightly 0.13% to 15,575 per US dollar, still outperforming neighboring currencies such as Malaysia (-0.30%), Thailand (-0.05%) and the Philippines (-0.65%). *Headline this has been released earlier in Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: ENRG Acquisition of Participation Rights in Sengkang Gas Block
marketNews.content: Kementerian Investasi reported that investment realization in Indonesia during the first nine months of 2024 reached 1,261 trillion rupiah, a 19.8% year‑on‑year increase, representing 76.4% of the 2024 target of 1,650 trillion rupiah. Foreign direct investment (PMA) amounted to 654 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY), while domestic investment (PMDN) grew to 607 trillion rupiah (+23% YoY). Chinese media outlet Caixin reported that the Chinese government may raise 6 trillion yuan (approximately 846 billion US dollars) through the issuance of special long‑term bonds over three years, intended to help local governments reduce debt burdens and stimulate a sluggish economy. This news appears amid speculation about the size of China’s upcoming fiscal stimulus package. Reuters surveyed economists expect Bank Indonesia to keep the BI Rate at 6% in the Monetary Policy Committee meeting on 16 October 2024, a shift from earlier expectations of a further cut after the surprise 25‑basis‑point reduction in the previous meeting. The change is driven by a slowdown in expectations of aggressive monetary easing by the Fed following solid US labor data, which has caused the rupiah to depreciate about 3% from its recent peak in September 2024. BPS announced that Indonesia’s trade surplus reached 3.26 billion US dollars in September 2024, surpassing consensus expectations of 2.83 billion dollars. Exports grew 6.44% YoY while imports grew 8.55% YoY, both below consensus forecasts of 8% and 11.8% respectively. Over the first nine months of 2024, the cumulative trade surplus was 27.72 billion US dollars, virtually unchanged from the same period in 2023. The Indian government announced a 9.15 trillion rupee (US$109 billion) power‑grid revamp plan to integrate 600 GW of renewable energy by 2032, targeting 500 GW by 2030 and an additional 100 GW thereafter. Warner Bros Discovery (NASDAQ: WBD) will launch its streaming service Max in seven Asian countries on 19 November 2024, expanding availability to more than 72 countries and offering content from HBO, Discovery, DC Universe, Harry Potter and Cartoon Network in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Taiwan and Hong Kong. Transcoal Pacific (TCPI) through its subsidiary PT Energy Transporter Indonesia announced the sale of one barge unit for 6 billion rupiah, aimed at fleet renewal. ITSEC Asia (CYBR) director Bambang Susilo sold 1.5 million shares at an average price of 311 rupiah per share between 11 and 14 October 2024, totaling approximately 478 million rupiah; his ownership fell from 0.486% to 0.463% after the transaction.

tickerNews.title: ENRG to Acquire 51% Participation Rights in Sengkang Gas Block
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada, through its subsidiary PT EMP Energi Jaya, announced that it has signed an agreement to acquire a 51% participation right in the cooperation contract (KKS) for the Sengkang Block in South Sulawesi. The transaction value was not disclosed, and the deal is expected to be completed by 31 October 2024. Currently, ENRG’s other subsidiary PT Energi Maju Abadi holds the remaining 49% participation right. The Sengkang KKS has a production capacity of about 50 million cubic feet of gas per day, with PLN as the primary off‑taker. The block holds proven and measured gas reserves of approximately 380 billion cubic feet.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Reports Net Profit of 55.5 Billion Rupiah in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya reported a net profit of 55.5 billion rupiah for the third quarter of 2024, a significant increase from the net profit of 11.1 billion rupiah in the same quarter of 2023 and 3.6 billion rupiah in the second quarter of 2024. The nine‑month net profit reached 69.3 billion rupiah, compared with 23.5 billion rupiah in the same period of 2023. The surge in Q3 profit was mainly due to a much smaller minority interest portion. Operating profit in Q3 2024 fell 57.9% year‑on‑year to 116.8 billion rupiah, although it still grew 43.6% quarter‑on‑quarter.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Reports No Casualties in Freeport Smelter Fire at Gresik
tickerNews.content: VP Corporate Communications of PT Freeport Indonesia, Katri Krisnati, stated that there were no casualties in the fire at Freeport's copper smelter located in the JIIPE industrial area owned by AKR Corporindo in Gresik, East Java. The fire occurred at 17:45 Western Indonesian Time on Monday (14/10) and has been extinguished. Katri added that the company will evaluate the main cause of the incident.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Subsidiary IBST Secures 600 Billion Rupiah Loan from Bank Permata
tickerNews.content: The subsidiary of Sarana Menara Nusantara, Inti Bangun Sejahtera (IBST), obtained a loan facility of 600 billion rupiah from Bank Permata (BNLI). The funds will be used for capital expenditures and refinancing of previous loans. The loan matures on 10 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: MARK Shareholder PT Dyna Capital Indo Sells Approximately 20.3 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Mark Dynamics Indonesia, PT Dyna Capital Indo, sold approximately 20.3 million MARK shares at an average price of 1,100 rupiah per share on 14 October 2024. The total transaction value was about 22.4 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Dyna Capital Indo’s ownership in MARK decreased from 21.23% to 20.7%.

tickerNews.title: DRMA Commissioner Noel Aelyo Purchases 1.2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: DRMA Commissioner Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara bought 1.2 million DRMA shares at an average price of 1,100 rupiah per share on 11 October 2024. The total transaction value was approximately 1.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Noel’s ownership in DRMA increased from 1.36% to 1.39%.

tickerNews.title: BBKP Plans to Issue Senior Unsecured Notes up to 300 Million USD
tickerNews.content: Bank KB Bukopin intends to issue senior unsecured notes amounting to up to 300 million US dollars (approximately 4.65 trillion rupiah). A roadshow for potential investors is scheduled for 16‑18 October 2024, with pricing to be set on 21 October 2024. The use of proceeds will be disclosed after the roadshow. The bonds will be listed on the Singapore Stock Exchange (SGX‑ST).

tickerNews.title: PYFA Signs MoU with Swiss RGCC for Personalized Cancer Treatment in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Pyridam Farma and the Research Genetic Cancer Center (RGCC), a Swiss cancer research institute, signed a memorandum of understanding on Tuesday (15/10) to introduce personalized cancer treatment in Indonesia. RGCC develops diagnostic tests and personalized cancer drugs. Through this cooperation, PYFA will become RGCC’s partner for marketing and distributing RGCC products in Indonesia, while RGCC will partner with PYFA to enter the European market, meeting quality standards required in that region.

tickerNews.title: RAJA Subsidiary Triguna Internusa Pratama Wins Booster Compression Plant Rental Contract
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja, through its subsidiary PT Triguna Internusa Pratama, obtained a contract to provide a booster compression plant rental service to Energy Equity Epic (Sengkang) Pty. Ltd. The transaction value was not disclosed. The cooperation is aimed at the development of the New Village in the Sengkang Block.
